author: Standard Business
title: Agency mulls lab to enhance coffee pricing at the auction
description: Nairobi Coffee Exchange has proposed the setting up of a cupping laboratory to help determine the value of the commodity vis-a-vis what the buyer is offering and the reserve price.

author: Scott Yunker
title: HawaiʻiUSA, Maui Oma launch new coffee to help Maui nonprofit, Imua Family Services
description: HawaiʻiUSA and Maui Oma Coffe Roasting Company created a custom coffee blend named 'Imua,' which appeared on store shelves this week. Proceeds from Imua Coffee purchases will go towards the nonprofit Imua Family Services.

author: Olivia Doak
title: CU Boulder professor creates 3D printing paste with coffee grounds
description: A CU Boulder professor created a 3D printing paste with coffee grounds to help reduce waste and improve sustainability of 3D printing.

author: Kate Ryan
title: Labor expert says union efforts have a ripple effect across industries
description: From coffee shops to factory floors, the actions by unions are having an impact on wages and benefits.

author: Bevan Hurley
title: McDonald’s sued over hot coffee spill three decades after landmark case
description: Mable Childress, 85, allegedly suffered severe burns after she was handed a coffee cup with a loose lid

author: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Liam Buckler)
title: McDonald's sued by woman 'scalded by burnt coffee that left her with severe burns'
description: Mable Childress, who is in her 80s, has launched a lawsuit against a McDonald's in San Francisco after she claimed employees at the Fillmore Street store “failed to properly secure the coffee cup lid”

author: The Boston Globe
title: Review: What we think of the new ‘spiked’ line of Dunkin’ coffees and teas
description: From spiked original iced coffee to half & half iced tea, Dunkin' is betting that there's a spiked drink for everyone.The post Review: What we think of the new ‘spiked’ line of Dunkin’ coffees and teas appeared first on Boston.com.

author: City Paper Staff
title: Young & Hungry Links, Sept. 20
description: Top coffee shops, fancy food at home, and a new French bistro that opens early

author: Matt Shea
title: Iconic Sydney coffee roasters Single O open a cosy Newstead cafe
description: It features self-serve oat milk iced latte on tap, Agnes Bakery pastries and a killer avocado on toast.

title: Iconic Sydney coffee roasters Single O open a cosy Newstead cafe
description: It features self-serve oat milk iced latte on tap, Agnes Bakery pastries and a killer avocado on toast.

author: silicon
title: Would you get a drone to deliver your coffee?
description: Manna CEO Bobby Healy joined the latest episode of For Tech’s Sake to talk about the growth of the drone industry and why Ireland is a leader in the space.Read more: Would you get a drone to deliver your coffee?

author: Jackson Guilfoil
title: Old Town Eureka roads get facelift, though some businesses express frustration
description: Businesses in the area remain open, but this week saw the pavement on F Street between First and Fourth streets and E Street between Second and Third streets wrenched out of the earth for road reconstruction. In an Instagram post, Old Town Coffee and Chocolates lambasted the city for taking out their parklet with outdoor seating, and expressed cynicism about whether it will be replaced.

author: Rachel Keck
title: ‘I was hooked.’ This Flowery Branch coffee roaster didn’t like coffee. Now, he hopes to make his brand a household name
description: Where one may hear the hum of a small coffee roasting operation, Jesus Palacios hears the melody of a dream come true.

author: Bradley Hicks
title: Arnold Air Force Base marks 76th birthday of U.S. Air Force in style
description: Dinner, dancing, dapper duds and elegant attire were the order of the evening Sept. 9 as the Arnold Air Force Base Company Grade Officers’ Council hosted the Arnold Engineering Development Complex Air Force Ball at the Manchester/Coffee County Conference Center. The ball was held to coincide with the 76th birthday of the U.S. Air Force. Disclaimer: The CGOC is a private organization which is not part of the Department of Defense or any of its components and has no governmental status

author: Ashee Pamma
title: Coffee Briefing Sept. 19 – Canada staggers in internet affordability in new report; ScotiaBank, JPMorgan team up; Amazon awards scholarships to 10 Canadian students; and more
description: Coffee Briefings are timely deliveries of the latest ITWC headlines, interviews, and podcasts. Today’s Coffee Briefing is delivered by IT World Canada’s editorial team! Missed last week’s Coffee Briefing? We’ve got you covered. Canada continues to falter in internet affordability in new report According to a new report by SurfShark, Canada has the second best internet

author: Jay Barmann
title: Elderly SF Woman Suing McDonald's Over Scalding Coffee In Similar Lawsuit to One From Early 90s
description: McDonald's still apparently serves their drive-thru coffee exceedingly hot, and a San Francisco woman is claiming that a poorly affixed lid on a coffee cup, served to her at the Fillmore McDonald's, led to her getting serious burns, and she's now suing.
